snippet: LEAD: A California agency said today that it had filed a multimillion-dollar lawsuit against Charles H. Keating Jr. and the American Continental Corporation, contending that the company put pressure on unsophisticated investors to buy its ''junk b...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: A California agency said today that it had filed a multimillion-dollar lawsuit against Charles H. Keating Jr. and the American Continental Corporation, contending that the company put pressure on unsophisticated investors to buy its ''junk bonds'' by saying they were insured by the Government and were free of risk.

headline.main: California Accuses Lincoln Of Misleading Bond Buyers

byline.original: By MICHAEL LEV, Special to The New York Times
